member.name: T:CitizenFX.Core.FastStructure`1
member.summary:
Emits optimized IL for the reading and writing of structures to/from memory.
For a 32-byte structure with 1 million iterations:
The method performs approx. 20x faster than (8ms vs 160ms), and about 1.6x slower than the non-generic equivalent (8ms vs 5ms)
The method performs approx. 8x faster than (4ms vs 34ms).

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthogonalize
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified matrix.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the matrix will be orthogonal to any other given row in the matrix.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthonormalize
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified matrix.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@)
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified matrix.
member.param: The matrix to orthogonalize.
When the method completes, contains the orthogonalized matrix.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the matrix will be orthogonal to any other given row in the matrix.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix)
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified matrix.
member.param: The matrix to orthogonalize.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the matrix will be orthogonal to any other given row in the matrix.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@)
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified matrix.
member.param: The matrix to orthonormalize.
When the method completes, contains the orthonormalized matrix.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix)
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified matrix.
member.param: The matrix to orthonormalize.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting matrix tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.
This operation is performed on the rows of the matrix rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.UpperTriangularForm(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@)
member.summary: Brings the matrix into upper triangular form using elementary row operations.
member.param: The matrix to put into upper triangular form.
When the method completes, contains the upper triangular matrix.
member.remarks: If the matrix is not invertible (i.e. its determinant is zero) than the result of this method may produce Single.Nan and Single.Inf values. When the matrix represents a system of linear equations, than this often means that either no solution exists or an infinite number of solutions exist.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix.ReducedRowEchelonForm(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector4@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector4@)
member.summary: Brings the matrix into reduced row echelon form using elementary row operations.
member.param: The matrix to put into reduced row echelon form.
The fifth column of the matrix.
When the method completes, contains the resultant matrix after the operation.
When the method completes, contains the resultant fifth column of the matrix.

remarks.para: The fifth column is often called the augmented part of the matrix. This is because the fifth column is really just an extension of the matrix so that there is a place to put all of the non-zero components after the operation is complete.
Often times the resultant matrix will the identity matrix or a matrix similar to the identity matrix. Sometimes, however, that is not possible and numbers other than zero and one may appear.

This method can be used to solve systems of linear equations. Upon completion of this method, the will contain the solution for the system. It is up to the user to analyze both the input and the result to determine if a solution really exists.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthogonalize
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the Matrix3x3 will be orthogonal to any other given row in the Matrix3x3.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthonormalize
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@)
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified Matrix3x3.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to orthogonalize.
When the method completes, contains the orthogonalized Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the Matrix3x3 will be orthogonal to any other given row in the Matrix3x3.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3)
member.summary: Orthogonalizes the specified Matrix3x3.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to orthogonalize.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all rows orthogonal to each other. This means that any given row in the Matrix3x3 will be orthogonal to any other given row in the Matrix3x3.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@)
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified Matrix3x3.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to orthonormalize.
When the method completes, contains the orthonormalized Matrix3x3.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3)
member.summary: Orthonormalizes the specified Matrix3x3.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to orthonormalize.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all rows and columns orthogonal to each other and making all rows and columns of unit length. This means that any given row will be orthogonal to any other given row and any given column will be orthogonal to any other given column. Any given row will not be orthogonal to any given column. Every row and every column will be of unit length.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting Matrix3x3 tends to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the rows so that the first row is the most stable and the last row is the least stable.

This operation is performed on the rows of the Matrix3x3 rather than the columns. If you wish for this operation to be performed on the columns, first transpose the input and than transpose the output.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3.UpperTriangularForm(CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix3x3@)
member.summary: Brings the Matrix3x3 into upper triangular form using elementary row operations.
member.param: The Matrix3x3 to put into upper triangular form.
When the method completes, contains the upper triangular Matrix3x3.
member.remarks: If the Matrix3x3 is not invertible (i.e. its determinant is zero) than the result of this method may produce Single.Nan and Single.Inf values. When the Matrix3x3 represents a system of linear equations, than this often means that either no solution exists or an infinite number of solutions exist.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector
When the method completes, contains the squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector2[])
member.summary: Orthogonalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthogonalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthogonalize.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other. This means that any given vector in the list will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector2[])
member.summary: Orthonormalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthonormalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthonormalize.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other and making all vectors of unit length. This means that any given vector will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.TransformCoordinate(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.param: The coordinate vector to transform.
The transformation .
When the method completes, contains the transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector2.TransformNormal(CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector2@)
member.summary: Performs a normal transformation using the given .
member.param: The normal vector to transform.
The transformation .
When the method completes, contains the transformed normal.
member.remarks: A normal transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is zero. This causes the fourth row and fourth column of the matrix to be unused. The end result is a vector that is not translated, but all other transformation properties apply. This is often preferred for normal vectors as normals purely represent direction rather than location because normal vectors should not be translated.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
When the method completes, contains the squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3,CitizenFX.Core.Vector3)

member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.

For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector3[])
member.summary: Orthogonalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthogonalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthogonalize.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other. This means that any given vector in the list will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector3[])
member.summary: Orthonormalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthonormalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthonormalize.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other and making all vectors of unit length. This means that any given vector will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.TransformCoordinate(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.param: The coordinate vector to transform.
The transformation .
When the method completes, contains the transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector3.TransformNormal(CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@,CitizenFX.Core.Matrix@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector3@)
member.summary: Performs a normal transformation using the given .
member.param: The normal vector to transform.
The transformation .
When the method completes, contains the transformed normal.
member.remarks: A normal transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is zero. This causes the fourth row and fourth column of the matrix to be unused. The end result is a vector that is not translated, but all other transformation properties apply. This is often preferred for normal vectors as normals purely represent direction rather than location because normal vectors should not be translated.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector4.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector4@,CitizenFX.Core.Vector4@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
When the method completes, contains the squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector4.DistanceSquared(CitizenFX.Core.Vector4,CitizenFX.Core.Vector4)

member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.

For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector4.Orthogonalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector4[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector4[])
member.summary: Orthogonalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthogonalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthogonalize.

remarks.para: Orthogonalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other. This means that any given vector in the list will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Vector4.Orthonormalize(CitizenFX.Core.Vector4[],CitizenFX.Core.Vector4[])
member.summary: Orthonormalizes a list of vectors.
member.param: The list of orthonormalized vectors.
The list of vectors to orthonormalize.

remarks.para: Orthonormalization is the process of making all vectors orthogonal to each other and making all vectors of unit length. This means that any given vector will be orthogonal to any other given vector in the list.

Because this method uses the modified Gram-Schmidt process, the resulting vectors tend to be numerically unstable. The numeric stability decreases according to the vectors position in the list so that the first vector is the most stable and the last vector is the least stable.

member.exception: Thrown when or is null.
Thrown when is shorter in length than .

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.REGISTER_COMMAND
member.summary:
**Experimental**: This native may be altered or removed in future versions of CitizenFX without warning.
Registers a set of archetypes with the game engine. These should match `CBaseArchetypeDef` class information from the game.

Registered commands can be executed by entering them in the client console (this works for client side and server side registered commands). Or by entering them in the server console/through an RCON client (only works for server side registered commands). Or if you use a supported chat resource, like the default one provided in the cfx-server-data repository, then you can enter the command in chat by prefixing it with a `/`.
Commands registered using this function can also be executed by resources, using the [`ExecuteCommand` native](#_0x561C060B).
The restricted bool is not used on the client side. Permissions can only be checked on the server side, so if you want to limit your command with an ace permission automatically, make it a server command (by registering it in a server script).
**Example result**:
![](https://i.imgur.com/TaCnG09.png)

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.REGISTER_ENTITIES
member.summary:
Registered commands can be executed by entering them in the client console (this works for client side and server side registered commands). Or by entering them in the server console/through an RCON client (only works for server side registered commands). Or if you use a supported chat resource, like the default one provided in the cfx-server-data repository, then you can enter the command in chat by prefixing it with a `/`.
Commands registered using this function can also be executed by resources, using the [`ExecuteCommand` native](#_0x561C060B).
The restricted bool is not used on the client side. Permissions can only be checked on the server side, so if you want to limit your command with an ace permission automatically, make it a server command (by registering it in a server script).
**Example result**:
![](https://i.imgur.com/TaCnG09.png)

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.SET_VEHICLE_WHEELIE_STATE
member.summary:
Example script: <https://pastebin.com/J6XGbkCW>
List of known states:
``` 1: Not wheeling. 65: Vehicle is ready to do wheelie (burnouting). 129: Vehicle is doing wheelie. ```

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.SET_VEHICLE_WHEEL_RIM_COLLIDER_SIZE
member.summary: Not sure what this changes, probably determines physical rim size in case the tire is blown.

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.SET_VEHICLE_WHEEL_SIZE
member.summary: Sets vehicle's wheels' size (size is the same for all the wheels, cannot get/set specific wheel of vehicle). Only works on non-default wheels. Returns whether change was successful (can be false if trying to set size for non-default wheels).

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.SET_VEHICLE_WHEEL_TIRE_COLLIDER_SIZE
member.summary: Use along with SetVehicleWheelSize to resize the wheels (this native sets the collider size affecting physics while SetVehicleWheelSize will change visual size).

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.SET_VEHICLE_WHEEL_TIRE_COLLIDER_WIDTH
member.summary: Use along with SetVehicleWheelWidth to resize the wheels (this native sets the collider width affecting physics while SetVehicleWheelWidth will change visual width).

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.SET_VEHICLE_WHEEL_WIDTH
member.summary: Sets vehicle's wheels' width (width is the same for all the wheels, cannot get/set specific wheel of vehicle). Only works on non-default wheels. Returns whether change was successful (can be false if trying to set width for non-default wheels).

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.SET_VEHICLE_WHEEL_X_OFFSET
member.summary:
Adjusts the offset of the specified wheel relative to the wheel's axle center. Needs to be called every frame in order to function properly, as GTA will reset the offset otherwise. This function can be especially useful to set the track width of a vehicle, for example:
``` function SetVehicleFrontTrackWidth(vehicle, width) SetVehicleWheelXOffset(vehicle, 0, -width/2) SetVehicleWheelXOffset(vehicle, 1, width/2) end ```

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.SET_VEHICLE_WHEEL_Y_ROTATION
member.summary:
Adjusts the offset of the specified wheel relative to the wheel's axle center. Needs to be called every frame in order to function properly, as GTA will reset the offset otherwise. This function can be especially useful to set the track width of a vehicle, for example:
``` function SetVehicleFrontTrackWidth(vehicle, width) SetVehicleWheelXOffset(vehicle, 0, -width/2) SetVehicleWheelXOffset(vehicle, 1, width/2) end ```

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.TASK_DISMOUNT_ANIMAL
member.summary: Dismounts the ped from the animal it's mounted on. taskFlag affects what side the rider gets off. 1 << 18 will get off on the left side, where any other value will get off on the right side. The only other known value are 1 << 17 and 1 << 24, which has the behavior of any other value (getting off the animal from the right side). p2-p5 are almost always 0.

member.name: F:CitizenFX.Core.Native.Hash.TASK_REACT
member.summary: Has the ped react to another entity. The reactionType determines how the ped reacts. p3 is 7.5f in the scripts. p4 is 0f. unkFlag is always 4. The rest of the parameters are unknown, but 0 is acceptable input. Here is a list of the different reaction type values by Mooshe: https://pastebin.com/Ju7BbmMt

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.MumbleSetVolumeOverride(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Overrides the output volume for a particular player on Mumble. This will also bypass 3D audio and distance calculations. -1.0 to reset the override. Set to -1.0 to reset the Volume override.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.RegisterCommand(System.String,CitizenFX.Core.Native.InputArgument,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registered commands can be executed by entering them in the client console (this works for client side and server side registered commands). Or by entering them in the server console/through an RCON client (only works for server side registered commands). Or if you use a supported chat resource, like the default one provided in the cfx-server-data repository, then you can enter the command in chat by prefixing it with a `/`. Commands registered using this function can also be executed by resources, using the [`ExecuteCommand` native](#_0x561C060B). The restricted bool is not used on the client side. Permissions can only be checked on the server side, so if you want to limit your command with an ace permission automatically, make it a server command (by registering it in a server script). **Example result**: ![](https://i.imgur.com/TaCnG09.png)
member.param: The command you want to register.
A handler function that gets called whenever the command is executed.
If this is a server command and you set this to true, then players will need the command.yourCommandName ace permission to execute this command.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.RegisterCommand2(System.String,CitizenFX.Core.Native.InputArgument,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registered commands can be executed by entering them in the client console (this works for client side and server side registered commands). Or by entering them in the server console/through an RCON client (only works for server side registered commands). Or if you use a supported chat resource, like the default one provided in the cfx-server-data repository, then you can enter the command in chat by prefixing it with a `/`. Commands registered using this function can also be executed by resources, using the [`ExecuteCommand` native](#_0x561C060B). The restricted bool is not used on the client side. Permissions can only be checked on the server side, so if you want to limit your command with an ace permission automatically, make it a server command (by registering it in a server script). **Example result**: ![](https://i.imgur.com/TaCnG09.png)
member.param: The command you want to register.
A handler function that gets called whenever the command is executed.
If this is a server command and you set this to true, then players will need the command.yourCommandName ace permission to execute this command.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.RegisterStreamingFileFromUrl(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: **Experimental**: This native may be altered or removed in future versions of CitizenFX without warning. Registers a file from an URL as a streaming asset in the GTA streaming subsystem. This will asynchronously register the asset, and caching is done based on the URL itself - cache headers are ignored. Use `IS_STREAMING_FILE_READY` to check if the asset has been registered successfully.
member.param: The file name to register as, for example `asset.ydr`.
The URL to fetch the asset from.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.SetMinimapOverlayDisplay(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the display info for a minimap overlay.
member.param: The minimap overlay ID.
The X position for the overlay. This is equivalent to a game coordinate X.
The Y position for the overlay. This is equivalent to a game coordinate Y, except that it's inverted (gfxY = -gameY).
The X scale for the overlay. This is equivalent to the Flash \_xscale property, therefore 100 = 100%.
The Y scale for the overlay. This is equivalent to the Flash \_yscale property.
The alpha value for the overlay. This is equivalent to the Flash \_alpha property, therefore 100 = 100%.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.SetVehicleWheelSize(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets vehicle's wheels' size (size is the same for all the wheels, cannot get/set specific wheel of vehicle). Only works on non-default wheels. Returns whether change was successful (can be false if trying to set size for non-default wheels).
member.param: The vehicle to set data for.
Size of the wheels (usually between 0.5 and 1.5 is reasonable).
member.returns: Bool - whether change was successful or not

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.SetVehicleWheelTireColliderSize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Use along with SetVehicleWheelSize to resize the wheels (this native sets the collider size affecting physics while SetVehicleWheelSize will change visual size).
member.param: The vehicle to obtain data for.
Index of wheel, 0-3.
Radius of tire collider.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.SetVehicleWheelTireColliderWidth(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Use along with SetVehicleWheelWidth to resize the wheels (this native sets the collider width affecting physics while SetVehicleWheelWidth will change visual width).
member.param: The vehicle to obtain data for.
Index of wheel, 0-3.
Width of tire collider.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.SetVehicleWheelWidth(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets vehicle's wheels' width (width is the same for all the wheels, cannot get/set specific wheel of vehicle). Only works on non-default wheels. Returns whether change was successful (can be false if trying to set width for non-default wheels).
member.param: The vehicle to set data for.
Width of the wheels (usually between 0.1 and 1.5 is reasonable).
member.returns: Bool - whether change was successful or not

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.SetVehicleWheelXOffset(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Adjusts the offset of the specified wheel relative to the wheel's axle center. Needs to be called every frame in order to function properly, as GTA will reset the offset otherwise. This function can be especially useful to set the track width of a vehicle, for example: ``` function SetVehicleFrontTrackWidth(vehicle, width) SetVehicleWheelXOffset(vehicle, 0, -width/2) SetVehicleWheelXOffset(vehicle, 1, width/2) end ```

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.SetVehicleWheelXOffset2(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Adjusts the offset of the specified wheel relative to the wheel's axle center. Needs to be called every frame in order to function properly, as GTA will reset the offset otherwise. This function can be especially useful to set the track width of a vehicle, for example: ``` function SetVehicleFrontTrackWidth(vehicle, width) SetVehicleWheelXOffset(vehicle, 0, -width/2) SetVehicleWheelXOffset(vehicle, 1, width/2) end ```

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.TaskDismountAnimal(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Dismounts the ped from the animal it's mounted on. taskFlag affects what side the rider gets off. 1 << 18 will get off on the left side, where any other value will get off on the right side. The only other known value are 1 << 17 and 1 << 24, which has the behavior of any other value (getting off the animal from the right side). p2-p5 are almost always 0.

member.name: M:CitizenFX.Core.Native.API.TaskReact(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Has the ped react to another entity. The reactionType determines how the ped reacts. p3 is 7.5f in the scripts. p4 is 0f. unkFlag is always 4. The rest of the parameters are unknown, but 0 is acceptable input. Here is a list of the different reaction type values by Mooshe: https://pastebin.com/Ju7BbmMt

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.EnhancedStackFrame.GetFileColumnNumber
member.summary: Gets the column number in the file that contains the code that is executing. This information is typically extracted from the debugging symbols for the executable.
member.returns: The file column number, or 0 (zero) if the file column number cannot be determined.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.EnhancedStackFrame.GetFileLineNumber
member.summary: Gets the line number in the file that contains the code that is executing. This information is typically extracted from the debugging symbols for the executable.
member.returns: The file line number, or 0 (zero) if the file line number cannot be determined.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.EnhancedStackFrame.GetFileName
member.summary: Gets the file name that contains the code that is executing. This information is typically extracted from the debugging symbols for the executable.
member.returns: The file name, or null if the file name cannot be determined.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.EnhancedStackFrame.GetILOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset from the start of the Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) code for the method that is executing. This offset might be an approximation depending on whether or not the just-in-time (JIT) compiler is generating debugging code. The generation of this debugging information is controlled by the System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute.
member.returns: The offset from the start of the MSIL code for the method that is executing.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.EnhancedStackFrame.GetMethod
member.summary: Gets the method in which the frame is executing.
member.returns: The method in which the frame is executing.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.EnhancedStackFrame.GetNativeOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset from the start of the native just-in-time (JIT)-compiled code for the method that is being executed. The generation of this debugging information is controlled by the System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute class.
member.returns: The offset from the start of the JIT-compiled code for the method that is being executed.

member.summary: Demystifies the given and tracks the original stack traces for the whole exception tree.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.ExceptionExtentions.ToStringDemystified(System.Exception)
member.summary: Gets demystified string representation of the .
member.remarks: method mutates the exception instance that can cause issues if a system relies on the stack trace be in the specific form. Unlike this method is pure. It calls first, computes a demystified string representation and then restores the original state of the exception back.
